intro: Platanthera angustata var. angustata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf twayblade, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wetlands. It has a rhizomatous root system and produces capsules as its fruit. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a sensitive indicator species for ecosystem health.
